org.lwjgl.openal

Class SOFTBufferSamples

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lwjgl.openal.SOFTBufferSamples

  • public final class SOFTBufferSamples
extends java.lang.Object
    bindings to AL_SOFT_buffer_samples extension.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static SOFTBufferSamples getInstance()
        Returns the SOFTBufferSamples instance for the current context.

      • alBufferSamplesSOFT

        public static void alBufferSamplesSOFT(int buffer,
                       int samplerate,
                       int internalformat,
                       int samples,
                       int channels,
                       int type,
                       java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
        To remove a buffer's sample data and replace it with new data, the alBufferSamplesSOFT function should be used. The named channels must be a buffer ID returned by alGenBuffers, and not currently be attached to or queued on a source. The given channels is the number of sample frames per second the data will play at, and the channels is the storage format used (see Table 1.1). The number of uncompressed sample frames to load is specified by channels.

        The channels and type parameters specify the channel configuration and sample type of the provided data (see Table 1.2 and 1.3). The samples will be converted to the internal storage format as needed, however the channel configuration must match the channel configuration of the storage format or an AL_INVALID_ENUM error will be generated.

        The data pointer should hold enough data as specified by the channels, type, and samples parameters, and will be copied and converted into the buffer's storage. It may also be NULL, in which case the stored data will be undefined.

        If AL_SOFT_loop_points is supported, a successful call will reset the start and end loop points to 0 and samples respectively.

        Parameters:
        buffer - buffer ID returned by alGenBuffers, and not currently be attached to or queued on a source
        samplerate - number of sample frames per second the data will play at
        internalformat - storage format used. One of:
        MONO8_SOFT, MONO16_SOFT, MONO32F_SOFT, STEREO8_SOFT, STEREO16_SOFT, STEREO32F_SOFT, QUAD8_SOFT, QUAD16_SOFT, QUAD32F_SOFT, REAR8_SOFT, REAR16_SOFT, REAR32F_SOFT, 5POINT1_8_SOFT, 5POINT1_16_SOFT, 5POINT1_32F_SOFT, 6POINT1_8_SOFT, 6POINT1_16_SOFT, 6POINT1_32F_SOFT, 7POINT1_8_SOFT, 7POINT1_16_SOFT, 7POINT1_32F_SOFT
        samples - number of uncompressed sample frames to load
        channels - channel configuration of the provided data. One of:
        MONO_SOFT, STEREO_SOFT, QUAD_SOFT, REAR_SOFT, 5POINT1_SOFT, 6POINT1_SOFT, 7POINT1_SOFT
        type - type of the provided data. One of:
        BYTE_SOFT, UNSIGNED_BYTE_SOFT, SHORT_SOFT, UNSIGNED_SHORT_SOFT, INT_SOFT, UNSIGNED_INT_SOFT, FLOAT_SOFT, DOUBLE_SOFT, BYTE3_SOFT, UNSIGNED_BYTE3_SOFT
        data - buffer to write to

      • alIsBufferFormatSupportedSOFT

        public static boolean alIsBufferFormatSupportedSOFT(int format)
        To query if a storage format is supported by the implementation, use the function alIsBufferFormatSupportedSOFT. The function returns false if the given format is not a recognized storage format. Otherwise, if it returns true it may be specified as the internalformat for alBufferSamplesSOFT.
        Parameters:
        format - format to check if supported. One of:
        MONO8_SOFT, MONO16_SOFT, MONO32F_SOFT, STEREO8_SOFT, STEREO16_SOFT, STEREO32F_SOFT, QUAD8_SOFT, QUAD16_SOFT, QUAD32F_SOFT, REAR8_SOFT, REAR16_SOFT, REAR32F_SOFT, 5POINT1_8_SOFT, 5POINT1_16_SOFT, 5POINT1_32F_SOFT, 6POINT1_8_SOFT, 6POINT1_16_SOFT, 6POINT1_32F_SOFT, 7POINT1_8_SOFT, 7POINT1_16_SOFT, 7POINT1_32F_SOFT

      • alBufferSubSamplesSOFT

        public static void alBufferSubSamplesSOFT(int buffer,
                          int offset,
                          int samples,
                          int channels,
                          int type,
                          java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
        To update a buffer with new data, call alBufferSubSamplesSOFT. buffer is the ID of the buffer to modify. offset is the first sample frame in the internal storage to be modified, and samples is the number of sample frames to modify. They must not extend beyond the existing internal storage length. The channels and type parameters specify the channel configuration and sample type of the provided data buffer, specified by data, which will be copied and converted to the buffer's storage format. As with alBufferSamplesSOFT, the channel configuration must match the storage format's channel configuration or an AL_INVALID_ENUM error will be generated.

        When modifying a buffer that's playing on a source, an application must take care to not modify the section that is currently being played. The read-only source attributes

        AL_BYTE_RW_OFFSETS_SOFT AL_SAMPLE_RW_OFFSETS_SOFT

        may be used to retrieve the read and write cursor offsets (see Table 3.0 and 3.1). Behavior is undefined if an attempt is made to modify buffer data between the read and write offsets.

        Parameters:
        buffer - ID of the buffer to modify
        offset - first sample frame in the internal storage to be modified
        samples - number of sample frames to modify. They must not extend beyond the existing internal storage length.
        channels - channel configuration of the provided data. One of:
        MONO_SOFT, STEREO_SOFT, QUAD_SOFT, REAR_SOFT, 5POINT1_SOFT, 6POINT1_SOFT, 7POINT1_SOFT
        type - type of the provided data. One of:
        BYTE_SOFT, UNSIGNED_BYTE_SOFT, SHORT_SOFT, UNSIGNED_SHORT_SOFT, INT_SOFT, UNSIGNED_INT_SOFT, FLOAT_SOFT, DOUBLE_SOFT, BYTE3_SOFT, UNSIGNED_BYTE3_SOFT
        data - buffer to write to

      • alGetBufferSamplesSOFT

        public static void alGetBufferSamplesSOFT(int buffer,
                          int offset,
                          int samples,
                          int channels,
                          int type,
                          java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
        To retrieve a buffer's sample data, use alGetBufferSamplesSOFT. This function will read the number of sample frames, given by samples, starting at offset, and convert them to the channel configuration and sample type specified by channels and type, before writing to the provided data buffer pointer. An AL_INVALID_VALUE error is generated if offset and samples reach beyond the range of the buffer. The channel configuration must match the internal storage format's channel configuration, or else an AL_INVALID_ENUM error will be generated.
        Parameters:
        buffer - ID of the buffer to modify
        offset - first sample frame in the internal storage to be modified
        samples - number of sample frames to modify. They must not extend beyond the existing internal storage length.
        channels - channel configuration of the provided data. One of:
        MONO_SOFT, STEREO_SOFT, QUAD_SOFT, REAR_SOFT, 5POINT1_SOFT, 6POINT1_SOFT, 7POINT1_SOFT
        type - type of the provided data. One of:
        BYTE_SOFT, UNSIGNED_BYTE_SOFT, SHORT_SOFT, UNSIGNED_SHORT_SOFT, INT_SOFT, UNSIGNED_INT_SOFT, FLOAT_SOFT, DOUBLE_SOFT, BYTE3_SOFT, UNSIGNED_BYTE3_SOFT
        data - buffer to write to
